subject: probability
title: Probability Mass Function
contentHtml:
The probability mass function (PMF) is a fundamental concept in discrete random variables.

Given a discrete random variable X with a finite or countable set of possible values, the PMF is a function that assigns a probability to each value.

workedExample.problemHtml: Suppose we have a coin flip with two possible outcomes: heads (H) and tails (T).

steps.explanation: The probability of getting heads is p.

intuition: The PMF helps us understand the likelihood of each possible outcome.
